page.title: 08Communication in Maylands
page.content: Most houses have their own private telephone. Three telephone kiosks all without directories and often vandalised. Four post boxes with twice daily collection taken to Chelmsford for sorting. One daily postal delivery with occasional extra delivery for businesses. Monthly Parish magazine prepared voluntarily by residents. Contains local news, notices about meetings, reports of clubs and activities. Supported by advertising and delivered free to every house. Large number of footpaths crossing farmland and along sea wall. Notably St. Peter's Way still used by pilgrims to the oldest religious building in Great Britain.
